meanings.definition: To put (a fine, loose, or powdery substance) through a sieve or sifter so as to remove lumps or large particles.
meanings.sent1: I will sift the flour to make sure there are no lumps in the cake batter.
meanings.sent2: She likes to sift the sand at the beach to find seashells.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to sift the sugar, but the sieve was missing!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter sifted through the room, brightening everyone's mood.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to sift the fallen leaves, creating a beautiful pattern on the ground.

meanings.definition: To examine (something) thoroughly so as to isolate that which is most important or useful.
meanings.sent1: He will sift through the documents to find the key information.
meanings.sent2: The detective had to sift through the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to sift through the library for the perfect book.
meanings.sent4: Her mind began to sift through memories of the past, searching for answers.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight seemed to sift through the leaves, creating a dappled effect on the ground.
